name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Aperitivo Italiano - Cicchetti e Vino in Bengaluru
description: Bengaluru, Sip & Savour Italy – One Glass at a TimeStep into a slice of Italy in the heart of Bengaluru! Aperitivo Italiano, part of IICCI’s Project Il Dolce Vino, invites you to an evening of exquisite wines, gourmet Italian delicacies, and expert-led tastings at the iconic Italia – The Park.Meet fellow wine lovers, connect with Indo-Italian business and lifestyle enthusiasts, and enjoy a vibrant cultural experience over glasses of fine Italian wine.🔹 Join us for an evening of La Dolce Vita – Bengaluru style!Note: Only one booking per person is allowed.

location.address: The Park, 14/7 14 7, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: Il Dolce Vino
organizer.description: Il Dolce Vino, by IICCI, promotes authentic Italian food and wine in India. It supports Italian exports via exclusive Wine Clubs in key cities, offering events, awareness programs, curated wine tours, and expert-led training, uniting the Indo-Italian food and wine community.

name: MEDITATIVE PAINTING
description: Meditative Painting is a slow, thoughtful approach to art, using acrylic ink and continuous line drawing to explore movement and form. With an emphasis on process over outcome, the practice encourages a more intuitive way of working; embracing flow, experimentation, and quiet observation. Through repetition and gentle focus, it becomes as much a reflective practice as a creative one. About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

location.address: 171, 3rd Cross Rd, Central Excise Layout, Sanjayanagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560094, India

name: Million Dollar Secret
description: ✨ Meet. Mingle. Misdirect. ✨INSPIRED by the Netflix Reality TV Show "💸Million Dollar Secret💸"Join us for a time of laughter, secrets, and surprises!One of you is playing a secret game. Can you figure out who?💰 One of you is secretly chosen to win the prize — if they can keep their identity hidden.The rest must use clues, deception, and deduction to expose the secret holder.If the group correctly guesses the secret person by the end, they steal the money.If they guess wrong, the secret holder takes it all.🍸 Drinks • 🍟 Snacks • 🕺 New Faces • 🎲 A Game of Deception📅 Date: 11 May 2025 (Sunday)⏰ Time: 5:00 pm onwards (estimate duartion 3 hrs)📍 Venue: Slay Coffee Bar (Koramangala)Trust no one... or trust everyone?

location.address: First Cross Road, V, Block, 139, 60 Feet Rd, KHB Block Koramangala, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Behind The Mask
organizer.description: We throw unique events, where mystery meets mischief, and every event is an enchanted escape from the ordinary.

name: PAINT YOUR EMOTIONS
description: Intuitive exploration of feeling through colour, form, and movement. Rather than focusing on technique or representation, the practice invites a more instinctive response to emotion translating mood and energy onto the canvas. With a focus on process over outcome, it offers space for reflection, release, and discovery through paint.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: THE ART OF JOURNALING
description: "The Art of Journaling" is a reflective course focused on personal reconnection and present moment awareness. It integrates writing prompts and drawing practices to foster creative expression and emotional clarity. Grounded in mindfulness, the course aims to mitigate anxiety through structured reflection. Participants will develop a journaling habit through observation, mark-making, and storytelling exercises. No prior experience is required, only curiosity and a willingness to engage in self-reflection.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: INTRODUCTION TO ABSTRACTION
description: "Introduction to Abstraction" is a process-driven painting course exploring form, colour, and texture beyond representation. Through guided exercises and intuitive techniques, participants express mood and movement. Emphasizing experimentation and inner rhythm, sessions focus on composition and color's emotional potential. No experience needed, just an open mind and willingness to explore.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: PAINTING FLOWERS
description: This class explores the art of painting blossoms, focusing on colour, form, and composition. Participants will learn how to capture the character and movement of floral subjects using drawing, layering, brushwork, and texture. Whether working in a loose or detailed style, the session encourages a balance between observation and personal expression, helping to develop confidence with paint while exploring the beauty of botanical forms.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: FLORAL COMPOSITIONS
description: This class explores the fundamentals of still life drawing through floral arrangements, focusing on observation, composition, and mark-making. Participants will develop confidence in line, shading, and tonal variation, capturing both structure and movement with a balance of accuracy and expression.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. name: MASTERING FLORISTRY
description: Discover the art of floristry through a thoughtful, hands-on course designed to teach the essentials of elegant bouquet design and floral layouts. In Mastering Floristry, we explore the beauty of working with botanicals; learning how to compose simple yet striking arrangements that bring harmony and character to your spaces.﻿About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. name: Summer at MAP
description: Summer holidays are here, and are the kids already chanting “I’m bored?”! Get them over to MAP for an exciting summer camp filled with art, learning and group activities facilitated by professional artists. Give your kids a summer to remember at the museum.The Mural Of The Story for 13 - 16 year olds (12th - 17th May, 2025)- 10.00 am - 4.00 pm Puppet making for 9 -12 year olds (19th - 24th May, 2025)- 11.00 am - 4.00 pm Registration fees is ₹1000. Number of participants are limited so please register to confirm your spot.

name: FUNDAMENTALS OF CANVAS PAINTING
description: This class offers a structured introduction to acrylic painting on canvas, covering essential techniques to build confidence and skill with the medium. Through guided exercises, participants will explore colour mixing, layering, brush control, and composition, learning how to create depth, texture, and balance in their work. The focus is on understanding acrylic properties, from blending and glazing to impasto techniques, while encouraging both precision and creative expression. Whether you’re a beginner or looking to refine your technique, this course provides a solid foundation for developing your own painting style.About your Instructors Divya Raveendran is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

location.address: 171, 3rd Cross Rd, Central Excise Layout, Sanjayanagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560094, India

organizer.name: Balsamic Walls
organizer.description: BalsamicWalls offers curated, 100% hand-painted abstract art for modern Indian spaces. We provide diverse, affordable pieces in various sizes and work with residential, commercial, and industrial clients on commissions, decor, and gifting.

name: Framing Motion with Ronita
description: Ronita Mookerji is a choreographer, performer, and contemporary dance artist with 16+ years of experience in interdisciplinary movement arts. She was a Senior Movement Artist at Attakkalari Dance Company for over seven years. Trained in Bharatanatyam for over 25 years and Odissi for two, she is also a certified yoga teacher and Animal Flow practitioner. A graduate of Attakkalari’s Diploma in Movement Arts and Mixed Media, she has trained in Kalaripayattu, Ballet, and Contact Improvisation.As a movement educator, Ronita has taught at institutions like Drama School Mumbai, FTII Pune, and Christ University Bangalore. She has performed and conducted workshops internationally, integrating contemporary dance, Kalaripayattu, and movement exploration.In this unique workshop, Ronita brings her deep dance experience into Animal Flow, blending strength, fluidity, and expressive movement for a dynamic and immersive session.We will incorporate lip smacking dishes from our signature kitchen into the brunch. We're so excited about this unique event because it’s more than just a dance, animal flow session or a brunch, it’s an experience that designed to recharge your body, and syncing with some primal movements.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

organizer.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Morning Raagas with Pt Kumar Mardur | Baithak
description: Just a note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistPt. Kumar Mardur, son of renowned Kirana Gharana vocalist Pandit Somanath Mardur, blends the styles of Kirana, Gwalior, and Jaipur gharanas to create a distinct gaayaki. Trained in Tabla and Hindustani vocals, he is known for his soulful voice, raga purity, and mastery of laya. A performer, composer, and former faculty at ITC-SRA Kolkata, Kumar has composed extensively in Khayaal, Bhajans, Kannada literature, and folk music.Accompanied by Trilochan Kampli on tabla and Satish Kolli on harmonium.This event is supported by Samagata Foundation.Terms and Conditions1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.5. Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.8. In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Fused Glass Suncatcher Workshop
description: Celebrate Mother’s Day with a Sparkle! 🌞💐Join us at Fired Up Studio for a heartwarming Suncatcher Making Workshop on May 11th from 4–6 PM. Whether you're creating a special handmade gift for Mom or spending quality time crafting together, this experience is sure to shine.In this hands-on session, you'll design your very own glass suncatcher using vibrant, translucent pieces. No two are alike—the designs are entirely up to you! The sample images shown are just to inspire you—you're free to create something that's truly your own.No prior experience needed, and all materials will be provided. Just bring your creativity and good vibes!🎨 Suitable for ages 8+ 🪟 Your suncatcher will be fired in our kiln after the workshop. You can pick up your finished piece a few days later, or opt for delivery (delivery charges apply). 📍 Venue: Fired Up Studio, 153 Biere St, Hagadur Main Rd, Whitefield 🎟️ Limited seats available—book early!

organizer.description: Dive into a world of creativity at Bangalore's premier craft studio. Our workshops provide all tools and supplies for a memorable experience, perfect for summer camps, weekend activities, birthdays, date activities, girls' nights out, or family fun.

name: Sunday Breakfast: Self-Help or Self-Hype?
description: Welcome to the Book Club No One Asked ForA cheeky book club brunch where we talk about self-help books that changed our lives or totally didn’t. No gurus, just good brunch banter.BYOB: Bring Your Own Book (or just your hot takes)

Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: Coffee & Conversations: Street Food Stories
description: We’re serving stories straight from the street! 😋Hosted by 'Priya Bala' a food writer and restaurant critic with a passion for street food and someone who’s tasted it all, this table is your go-to for fascinating street food stories!Pull up a chair, sip some chai, and let’s talk all things street foodFrom your favorite finds, childhood cravings, and the flavors that live rent-free in your memory.No forks, no filter—just good vibes, great convos, and a whole lot of food love! 🌯

name: Coming Home to Yourself: A Self-Compassion Session
description: "Coming Home to Yourself: A Self-Compassion Workshop"Join us for a heart-centred workshop designed to help you reconnect with yourself through the gentle power of self-compassion. In a world that often demands perfection, this space invites you to show up as you are—flawed, messy, and beautifully human.Through guided reflections, interactive exercises, and supportive conversation, you'll explore:- What self-compassion really means (and what it doesn't)- How to be kinder to yourself during moments of stress, failure, or self-doubt- Practical tools you can use daily to soothe your inner critic and nurture inner peaceWhether you're just beginning your journey or looking to deepen your practice, this workshop offers a safe, non-judgmental space to pause, breathe, and begin again—with love.Ideal for: Anyone curious about self-growth, emotional well-being, or simply looking for a kinder way to relate to themselves.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru @ Pebbles on 25th May
description: This evening is all about celebration and coming together as an inclusive community supporting a worldwide conscious movement where we will arrive at a safer space to let go, feel free, connect with our authentic selves and move to the organic beats of our body with, ECSTATIC DANCE BENGALURUDance for WellnessYour monthly doze of Dance Medicine. (Every last Sunday of the month) 📅 25th May 2025 | Sunday ⏳ 5pm - 7pm 📍Pebble - The Jungle Lounge ★ TIMELINE4.30pm: Doors open 4.45pm: Check in / warm up music 5.00pm: : Opening circle / intro 5.15pm: Ecstatic Dance set 6.45pm: Closing / sharing circle 7.00pm : Hugs & Hangout (Doors close at 5.15pm. Kindly arrive on time.) ★ ABOUT: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru is a regular conscious dance chapter with monthly free flow sessions, powered by Ecstatic World, pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020. From the makers of Odessa Amsterdam, the most popular conscious dance hub in Amsterdam, they create transformational experiences with Ecstatic Dance as dance for wellness for all. 👣 Dance for your well being 👣 Dance for your mental health👣 Dance as a self love ritual 👣 Dance for all 👣 Dance for freedom 👣 Dance for change 👣 Dance to life With Ecstatic Dance, we will connect with the self and others, enjoy moments of bliss and freedom, allowing the music to take us on a musical journey following a few basic guidelines. ★ ECSTATIC DANCE GUIDELINESIn ecstatic dance, We are without 🙅🏾👣 Footwear, to be grounded 🍺 Intoxicants, to be clear 🤐 Talking, to be embodied 📷 Mobile phones / camera, to be fully present Ft. ★ SIVA PRAYOJAN Siva Prayojan is celebrated as a multifaceted artist who seamlesslyblends a wide array of electronic music genres, including Techno, Melodic, Progressive, Drum and Bass, andTrance. His artistic journey, which commenced in 2021, is marked by a resolute departure from mainstream trends.Known for pushing boundaries, he continues to experiment with newsounds and redefining each performance for a deep dance journey.He expresses immense gratitude for the profound resonance his music finds in the hearts of those who immerse themselves in his sonic landscapes.We at Ecstatic World are elated to have him on board as our musical guide for the Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru chapter.     ★ ADDITIONAL INFO- We maintain our personal boundaries with the namaste sign. - Respect the space and one another.- Move however you wish. - If you are coming with a child, kindly tend to them wholeheartedly so as to maintain the quietness of the space during the opening and closing circle. - Dress comfortable. -Kindly take care of personal hygiene before joining the session. -Avoid wearing strong smelling perfumes / synthetic fragrances.-Maximum capacity 100 per session. - Please kindly note that upon purchasing a ticket, ED Bengaluru team and management are not liable for any injury that may incur at the session. That you agree to take full responsibility of yourself, your child’s safety and all of your belongings. ★ DRESS CODE   The fit you shine best in. ★ TICKET PRICE1500 INR (incl. taxes), via Urbanaut 2000 INR (incl.taxes), at the door Student ticket available at 50 % discount (at the door)  ▪Mandatory to produce a valid student ID card at check in.▪no cash, only gpay !★ CONNECTTag us on your IG stories and posts to let us know you are coming. Help us spread the awareness of this conscious dance practice in your own creative way and get a chance to win a free ticket for our upcoming sessions. IG : @ecstaticdancebengaluruFB : Ecstatic World  WhatsApp: ‪+91 93247 65794‬Email: ecstaticdanceworld@gmail.com ★ VENUE Pebble - The Jungle Lounge,Palace Grounds 3, Bellary Road,     Bengaluru-560080 ★ DESIGN  Elevantis Studio★ JOIN THE CONSCIOUS GLOBAL DANCE MOVEMENT HAPPENING IN ALL MAJOR CITIES/ COUNTRIES AROUND WORLD.....🌻 #befreebeyou 👣 #ecstaticdancebengaluru 🇮🇳 #ecstaticdanceindia ♥ #danceforwellness🏳‍🌈 #inclusivity🌏 #globalcommunity🙏🏾 #safespace

location.address: Gate number 9, Princess Academy, Palace Grounds 3 , Ramana Maharishi Road, Bellary Rd, Jayamahal, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560080, India

organizer.name: Ecstatic World
organizer.description: Pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020, ECSTATIC WORLD is a conscious events company creating transformational experiences. The logo of Ecstatic World is an Egyptian sign symbolizing, 'Transformation of the self'.

name: Feast of Fire & Smoke: Shangri-La Bengaluru
description: Fire meets smoke, and legends awaken. A timeless experience is on the horizon, where the allure of vintage charm meets the world of whisky. Are you ready to step into the past and uncover what’s about to unfold?Swear your loyalty to the House of Black by cloaking yourself in shadowy hues, or let your loyalty shine bright with the verdant tones of the House of Green.If you’re ready to experience a feast truly fit for royalty, join us for a night of great whiskies, delicious  food & music!

location.address: No. 56, 6B, Palace Rd, Abshot Layout, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: The Dram Club
organizer.description: Sip & savour with the coolest community of whisky & spirits enthusiasts for unforgettable experiences. Let's raise a glass to the finer things in life!

name: Real Style, Real Bodies
description: Tired of fashion trends that don’t feel like you? Join fashion designer and stylist Shiny Alexander for a transformative session on learning how to style your unique body type with confidence and ease. Learn how to dress for your body type with confidence and ease — no chasing trends, just discovering what works for you.💃 Rediscover your personal style 🧥 Learn what suits your body—not what’s trending 👗 Elevate your everyday wardrobe effortlesslyReal, everyday style that’s grounded in confidence and authenticity. In a world of fast fashion and unrealistic standards, this session is a reminder that style isn’t one-size-fits-all. It’s personal, powerful, and deeply connected to how we show up in the world.

location.address: 85, 2nd Main Rd, next to Barbeque Nation, 1st Block Koramangala, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034, India

organizer.description: MyBoTree, founded by three women, is a vibrant hub for purpose-driven programs focused on joyful, transformative experiences that empower communities and individuals to grow and connect. They actively partner with social enterprises and non-profits.

name: Screening of Sleep Has Her House (2017) with TPCC
description: Our weekly meetings feature a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. Led by one of our members or occasionally a guest speaker, the discussion encourages participants to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.Sleep Has Her House (2017)The shadows of screams climb beyond the hills. It has happened before. But this will be the last time. The last few sense it, withdrawing deep into the forest. They cry out into the black, as the shadows pass away, into the ground.About The Parallel Cinema ClubA community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

location.address: 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai, #24 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Underline Center
organizer.description: We're a community center for thoughtful, kind, and interesting events.

name: Mother's Day Pottery Workshop
description: Celebrate Mother's Day with Clay & ConnectionLooking for a meaningful way to spend Mother’s Day? Join us for a warm and creative pottery workshop designed especially for mothers and their children. Whether you're a complete beginner or just looking to try something new together, this session is all about bonding, learning, and getting your hands messy in the best way.In this 2-hour workshop, you’ll be introduced to the basics of pottery through both wheel throwing and hand-building (sculpting) techniques. With guidance from experienced instructors, you’ll create at least two unique ceramic pieces to take home as beautiful keepsakes of your time together.No prior experience neededAll materials providedMinimum of two handmade pieces to take homeCome, celebrate creativity and connection this Mother's Day, one spin of the wheel at a time.

name: The Love Lab
description: A date that’s fun, fresh, and a little bit genius.Think you know each other? Time to test the theory.The Love Lab is a playful, pop-up experience for couples who want to connect, laugh, and learn something new (without the pressure).Not therapy. Not a boring workshop. Just a super fun way to upgrade your relationship — with mini challenges, games, and tools you’ll actually use.Try out relationship “experiments” backed by real scienceExplore quirky communication boothsTeam up for couple games & connection promptsNo lectures. No pressure. No “fixing” required.Just two people, some cool tools, and a little relationship magic.Whether you’re a few dates in or years into forever—this is your excuse to ditch the usual and do something unforgettable. Together.📅 When:June 7th, 4 pm onwards (you can stay for as long as you like, we close at 8pm)📍Where:21/1, Church Rd, Kanakapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004📞 Contact: +91 63664 29922

location.address: 21/1, Church Rd, Kanakapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India

name: Once Upon A Farm!
description: Once Upon A Farm!A Day of Animals, Stories and Play for Families at Go Native, Whitefield. Come with your little ones for a day of "a little bit of everything for everyone". Catch a storytelling session, browse the shopping aisles while your little ones get creative, eat healthy and wholesome snacks or a meal at the cafe.. The perfect way to spend your Saturday!Animal Story Time Join us for scheduled storytelling sessions that bring the sights, sounds and spirits of Indian farm animals to life. Through lively narration, songs and movement, children experience farm life alongside brave dogs, clever cats, naughty goats and singing roosters.Storytelling Timings -  11:30 am - 12:30 pm ( Morning session)  4:30 pm - 5:30 pm (Evening Session)  Animal Art & Craft Corner Explore the animal art & craft corner and let your imagination run wild. Decorate your own paper pig mask, weave colourful wool into a sheep fleece or make your own clever cat. All materials are non-toxic, eco friendly and perfectly sized for tiny hands. ( with grownup helpers close by)Build Your Own Barn Role play with your little one to construct a miniature barn from wooden blocks for the animals to stay safe in rainy weather. What kind of house does the cow want?Feed The Animals Do you know what food the animals like to eat? Does a goat eat idlis or hay? What do you think? Let's explore.

location.address: No 36 Whitefield Main Rd Dyavasandra Industrial Area, near Airbus, Garudachar Palya, Mahadevapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560048, India
